cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 220 mi (355 km) SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to begin a slow west-northwest motion later Sunday, then turn northwest to north and move inland along the central-upper Texas coast Monday night into Tuesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central–upper Texas coast (around Matagorda Bay/Freeport area)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning; Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Aransas TX to High Island TX (Hurricane); south of Port Aransas to the Mouth of the Rio Grande (Tropical Storm)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas TX to Morgan City LA (Tropical Storm); Port Aransas TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA including Galveston Bay (Storm Surge)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coastline from Port Aransas through Galveston Bay and Sabine Pass, extending into southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–50 mph with higher gusts) possible Monday afternoon through Tuesday in the Galveston Bay/Houston Ship Channel area.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible in Galveston Bay, including the Houston Ship Channel, beginning late Sunday and persisting into Tuesday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches with isolated totals up to 20 inches possible across coastal southeast Texas, producing flash and urban flooding in the Houston metro and port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; prolonged high water in the Ship Channel could disrupt vessel traffic and terminal operations.
